metadata.title: CVE-2025-21555 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component:InnoDB).  Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.40 and prior, 8.4.3and prior and  9.1.0 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allowshigh privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols tocompromise MySQL Server.  Successful attacks of this vulnerability canresult in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatablecrash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server as well as  unauthorized update,insert or delete access to some of MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.1Base Score 5.5 (Integrity and Availability impacts).  CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.1/AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:H).

criterions.comment: mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'see notes').
